original: lus rtsub skems sems rgod tshig mang grang rlung gi mi //
analyzed: lus rtsub skems sems rgod tshig mang grang rlung gi mi //
translated: The person of wind is rough, dry, and thin, with a sharp mind, many words, and cold limbs.

original: dmar ser blo rno khro la drod che dri can mkhris pa'i mi //
analyzed: dmar ser blo rno khro la drod che dri can mkhris pa'i mi //
translated: The person of bile is reddish, sharp-minded, angry, and hot, with a bad smell.

original: dkar snum tshig g-yung lci la drod chung gnyid chung bad kan mi //
analyzed: dkar snum tshig g-yung lci la drod chung gnyid chung bad kan mi //
translated: The person of phlegm is white, oily, slow, heavy, and cold, with little sleep.

original: @9a * // gnyis dang gsum du 'dres pa yang ni de las shes par bya //
analyzed: @9a * // gnyis dang gsum du 'dres pa yang ni de las shes par bya //
translated: The person with a combination of two or three humors should be understood from that.

original: rgan dang dar dang byis pa rim gyis lta zhing shes par bya //
analyzed: rgan dang dar dang byis pa rim gyis lta zhing shes par bya //
translated: One should look and understand the elderly, the young, and the middle-aged in order.

original: ngad can grang ba rlung gi yul te tsha gdung mkhris pa'i sa //
analyzed: ngad can grang ba rlung gi yul te tsha gdung mkhris pa'i sa //
translated: The cold and windy place is the domain of wind, the hot and dry place is the domain of bile,

original: rlan can snum bag bad kan yul te 'dres pa de las brtag nang par srod ni bad kan tho rangs phyi dro rlung gi dus //
analyzed: rlan can snum bag bad kan yul te 'dres pa de las brtag nang par srod ni bad kan tho rangs phyi dro rlung gi dus //
translated: and the moist and oily place is the domain of phlegm. The mixed [humors] should be examined from that. The time of phlegm is morning and evening, the time of wind is dawn and afternoon,

original: nyi ma phyed dang nam phyed mkhris pa'i dus yin shes par bya //
analyzed: nyi ma phyed dang nam phyed mkhris pa'i dus yin shes par bya //
translated: and the time of bile is noon and midnight. One should understand this.🔽In spring, phlegm increases; in the first half of summer, wind, etc.; in autumn, bile increases;

original: dpyid na bad kan ldang ste dbyar stod rlung sogs ston mkhris ldang // dbyar smad rlung ldang mkhris sogs dgun stod dgun smad bad kan sogs //
analyzed: dpyid na bad kan ldang ste dbyar stod rlung sogs ston mkhris ldang // dbyar smad rlung ldang mkhris sogs dgun stod dgun smad bad kan sogs //
translated: in the second half of summer, wind increases; in the first half of winter, bile, etc.; in the second half of winter, phlegm, etc.

original: ston ni rlung zhi dgun stod mkhris zhi dbyar smad bad kan zhi //
analyzed: ston ni rlung zhi dgun stod mkhris zhi dbyar smad bad kan zhi //
translated: Autumn is the pacifier of wind, early winter is the pacifier of bile, and late summer is the pacifier of phlegm.

original: lus yul dus dag brjod nas bro drug khyad par mdor bstan pa //
analyzed: lus yul dus dag brjod nas bro drug khyad par mdor bstan pa //
translated: Having described the body, the place, and the time, the six tastes are briefly taught in particular.

original: mngar kun bsil te bad kan skyed de rlung mkhris sel byed na //
analyzed: mngar kun bsil te bad kan skyed de rlung mkhris sel byed na //
translated: Sweet is cooling, produces phlegm, and eliminates wind and bile.

original: zhun mar bu ram snying gzer gze ma gro dang starka dro //
analyzed: zhun mar bu ram snying gzer gze ma gro dang starka dro //
translated: Clarified butter, molasses, and ginger are warm, and wheat and barley are warm.

original: mu ka sbrang rtsi skam sa'i sha dang nas dang bu ram rnying //
analyzed: mu ka sbrang rtsi skam sa'i sha dang nas dang bu ram rnying //
translated: Mūlaka, honey, meat from dry land, barley, and old molasses

original: bad kan sel te nye shing ram nye bad kan mi skyed snyoms //
analyzed: bad kan sel te nye shing ram nye bad kan mi skyed snyoms //
translated: eliminate phlegm, and fresh and old molasses do not produce phlegm, but are neutral.

original: tsha ba dro ste mkhris skye rlung dang bad kan sel byed na //
analyzed: tsha ba dro ste mkhris skye rlung dang bad kan sel byed na //
translated: Hot is warm, produces bile, and eliminates wind and phlegm.

original: srog chags mkhris pa mkhris sel na le sham ni rlung yang skyed //
analyzed: srog chags mkhris pa mkhris sel na le sham ni rlung yang skyed //
translated: Animal bile eliminates bile, and long pepper also produces wind.

original: skyur kun dro ste mkhris pa skyed cing bad kan rlung sel na //
analyzed: skyur kun dro ste mkhris pa skyed cing bad kan rlung sel na //
translated: Sour is warm, produces bile, and eliminates phlegm and wind.

original: skyu ru ra dang bal po se'u ni mkhris pa sel bar byed //
analyzed: skyu ru ra dang bal po se'u ni mkhris pa sel bar byed //
translated: Tamarind and pomegranate eliminate bile.

original: ku shu mngar ni bsil la dar ba chus bslad mkhris mi skyed //
analyzed: ku shu mngar ni bsil la dar ba chus bslad mkhris mi skyed //
translated: Sweet apples are cooling, and sour ones mixed with water do not produce bile.

original: kha ba bsil te rlung skyed bad kan mkhris pa sel byed na //
analyzed: kha ba bsil te rlung skyed bad kan mkhris pa sel byed na //
translated: Snow is cooling and wind-producing, and eliminates phlegm and bile.

original: shu dag sle tres dro ste 'phrod dang sbyar na rlung yang sel //
analyzed: shu dag sle tres dro ste 'phrod dang sbyar na rlung yang sel //
translated: If it is combined with warm and compatible foods such as coriander and garlic, it also eliminates wind.

original: bska ba kun ni bsil te rlung skyed bad kan mkhris sel na //
analyzed: bska ba kun ni bsil te rlung skyed bad kan mkhris sel na //
translated: All astringents are cooling, wind-producing, and eliminate phlegm and bile.

original: aa ru ra ni nyes pa gsum pa gnod mi byed de snyoms //
analyzed: aa ru ra ni nyes pa gsum pa gnod mi byed de snyoms //
translated: Yellow myrobalan does not cause the three faults, but is neutral.

original: chang ran bad kan rlung sel mang na mkhris pa skyed par byed //
analyzed: chang ran bad kan rlung sel mang na mkhris pa skyed par byed //
translated: Wine is appropriate for phlegm and wind, but in excess it produces bile.

original: lan tshva dro ste rlung sel bad kan mkhris pa skye byed na //
analyzed: lan tshva dro ste rlung sel bad kan mkhris pa skye byed na //
translated: Salt is warm, eliminates wind, and produces phlegm and bile.

original: rgyam tsha lce myang tsha ni mkhris pa las yang gnod mi byed //
analyzed: rgyam tsha lce myang tsha ni mkhris pa las yang gnod mi byed //
translated: But rock salt and black salt do not harm bile.

original: mngar dang bska dang lan tshva gsum yang rim bzhin mas lci ste //
analyzed: mngar dang bska dang lan tshva gsum yang rim bzhin mas lci ste //
translated: The three tastes sweet, astringent, and salty are heavy in order,

original: skyur dang tsha dang kha ba gsum ni de bzhin mar zhing yang //🔽kha ba bska dang lan tshva gsum yang rim bzhin mas rtsub ste //
analyzed: skyur dang tsha dang kha ba gsum ni de bzhin mar zhing yang // kha ba bska dang lan tshva gsum yang rim bzhin mas rtsub ste //
translated: and the three tastes sour, pungent, and bitter are light in the same order.🔽The three tastes bitter, astringent, and salty are rough in order,

original: mngar dang skyur dang tsha ba gsum yang de bzhin mar zhing 'jam //
analyzed: mngar dang skyur dang tsha ba gsum yang de bzhin mar zhing 'jam //
translated: and the three tastes sweet, sour, and pungent are smooth in the same order.

original: @9b rlung mkhris bad kan gsum ka 'dra ste nyid kyis nyid skyes pas //
analyzed: @9b rlung mkhris bad kan gsum ka 'dra ste nyid kyis nyid skyes pas //
translated: The three humors—wind, bile, and phlegm—are similar in that they are produced by themselves.

original: lus dang yul dus zas spyod tshul gcig 'dom na nad ldang ste //
analyzed: lus dang yul dus zas spyod tshul gcig 'dom na nad ldang ste //
translated: When the body, the place, the time, and the diet and behavior are the same, the disease arises.

original: ji ltar mthun par 'phrod sbyar rlung mkhris bad kan mi ldang phan //
analyzed: ji ltar mthun par 'phrod sbyar rlung mkhris bad kan mi ldang phan //
translated: When they are in harmony, they are compatible, and the wind, bile, and phlegm are beneficial.

original: de phyir 'phrod dang mi 'phrod la sogs tshul bzhin 'dir bstan pa //
analyzed: de phyir 'phrod dang mi 'phrod la sogs tshul bzhin 'dir bstan pa //
translated: Therefore, here I will teach properly about compatibility and incompatibility, and so forth.

original: rlung ni mngar snum lci dro 'phrod de rtsub yang bsil mi 'phrod //🔽mkhris pa kha mngar bsil dang 'phrod de tsha skyur dro mi 'phrod //
analyzed: rlung ni mngar snum lci dro 'phrod de rtsub yang bsil mi 'phrod // mkhris pa kha mngar bsil dang 'phrod de tsha skyur dro mi 'phrod //
translated: Wind is compatible with sweet, oily, heavy, and warm; it is incompatible with rough, light, and cold.🔽Bile is compatible with sweet, cold, and sour; it is incompatible with hot, sour, and warm.

original: bad kan snum lci bsil dang mi 'phrod rtsub tsha spyod dang 'phrod //
analyzed: bad kan snum lci bsil dang mi 'phrod rtsub tsha spyod dang 'phrod //
translated: Phlegm is incompatible with oily, heavy, and cold; it is compatible with rough, hot, and dry behavior.

original: de bas rang gi lus dang dus gnas zas dang 'phrod spyad phyir //
analyzed: de bas rang gi lus dang dus gnas zas dang 'phrod spyad phyir //
translated: Therefore, for the sake of compatibility with one’s own body, time, place, diet, and behavior,

analyzed: dpyid zla gnyis ni bad kan bskyed dus yin te nad ldang bas //
translated: the two spring months are the time for producing phlegm, and the disease arises.

original: bad kan drang zhing bkru sman skyug sman btang zhing chu tshan btung //
analyzed: bad kan drang zhing bkru sman skyug sman btang zhing chu tshan btung //
translated: Phlegm is straightened, purgation medicine and emetic medicine are administered, and hot water is drunk.

original: gro nas bsreg sha sbrang rtsi la sogs rtsub bska yang ba bza' //
analyzed: gro nas bsreg sha sbrang rtsi la sogs rtsub bska yang ba bza' //
translated: Eat wheat, barley, meat, honey, and so forth, even if rough, dry, or light.

original: sbrang chang rgun chang sga chu sbrang chu bu ram chang nyid btung //
analyzed: sbrang chang rgun chang sga chu sbrang chu bu ram chang nyid btung //
translated: Drink bee wine, grape wine, ginger water, honey water, and sugarcane wine.

original: mar tshil la sogs snum lci kha ra skyur po tsha phrom dag ;
analyzed: mar tshil la sogs snum lci kha ra skyur po tsha phrom dag ;
translated: Eat oils, fats, and so forth, sweet, sour, and hot,

original: / mngar 'jam skyur na bsil bag yang zhing nyin par log mi bya //
analyzed: / mngar 'jam skyur na bsil bag yang zhing nyin par log mi bya //
translated: sweet, smooth, and sour, cool, light, and not inverted during the day.

analyzed: chu tshas lus bkru mnye zhing las bskyod ba cag bya ci ran bya //
translated: Bathe the body with water, massage, and do work as appropriate.

analyzed: gnas kyang ha cang mi tsha mi grang ran dro grib mar 'dug dbyar stod zla gnyis ma 'bri dus yin nyal po drag shul spang //
translated: The place should be neither too hot nor too cold, but comfortable, warm, and shady. In the first two months of summer, it is not the time for intercourse or strenuous activity.

analyzed: dal dub mi bya bag 'bras 'o ma mar sar sha dag bza' //
translated: Do not be lazy. Eat rice, milk, ghee, meat,

original: bu ram tshil ni cung zad bza' ste chang nyung yang ba btung //
analyzed: bu ram tshil ni cung zad bza' ste chang nyung yang ba btung //
translated: and eat a little sugar and fat, drink a little wine.

original: 'o ma bskol grang kha ras btab dang dar ba 'thungs na phan //
analyzed: 'o ma bskol grang kha ras btab dang dar ba 'thungs na phan //
translated: Drinking boiled milk cooled with a cloth or buttermilk is beneficial.

original: lan tsha skyur zhing na le sham la sogs pa tsha skyur spang //
analyzed: lan tsha skyur zhing na le sham la sogs pa tsha skyur spang //
translated: Avoid salt, sour, and pungent foods such as asafoetida.

original: chu 'jam tsam gyis lus bkru sgra snyan mnyan zhing gdags ;
analyzed: chu 'jam tsam gyis lus bkru sgra snyan mnyan zhing gdags ;
translated: Wash the body with lukewarm water, listen to music, and apply ointments.

original: / char par reg bya nyin par tsog bur gnyid kyis log na phan //
analyzed: / char par reg bya nyin par tsog bur gnyid kyis log na phan //
translated: Rain, tactile sensations, sleeping in a squatting position during the day are helpful.

original: gnas kyang ser bu drag po'i ngad med dro min bsil bar 'dug / dbyar smad zla ba gnyis na mkhris pa sogs shing rlung ldang ste //
analyzed: gnas kyang ser bu drag po'i ngad med dro min bsil bar 'dug / dbyar smad zla ba gnyis na mkhris pa sogs shing rlung ldang ste //
translated: The place should be cool, not hot, with a gentle breeze. In the last two months of summer, bile and so forth arise.

analyzed: phyi rol tsha la lus kyi nang grang nad gsum g-yos pas na // rlung nad bsal phyir lus mnye snum bsku sman chu bskol bas bkru //
translated: Since the three humors are disturbed by the external heat and internal cold,🔽to remove the wind disorder, massage the body, apply oil, take medicine, and wash with hot water.

analyzed: rlung nad sel des til mar mas gtong dugs dang lums kyang bya //
translated: To remove the wind disorder, use sesame oil, massage, and compresses.

analyzed: zas kyang ha cang tsha min mngar skyur med par ran par sbyar //
translated: Also, the food should be neither too hot, nor sweet or sour, but suitable.

original: pho ba drod skyed bag dang mar tshil sbrang rtsi bar 'ga' bza' //
analyzed: pho ba drod skyed bag dang mar tshil sbrang rtsi bar 'ga' bza' //
translated: To generate heat in the stomach, eat meat, fat, and honey from time to time.

original: yos dang @10a * //
analyzed: yos dang @10a * //
translated: Eat rabbit,

original: 'bras chan mar khus blugs dang zan dron sha dag bza' //
analyzed: 'bras chan mar khus blugs dang zan dron sha dag bza' //
translated: rice, and porridge with ghee, and meat.

original: chang yang cung zad btung ste chu dang chu grog spang bar bya //
analyzed: chang yang cung zad btung ste chu dang chu grog spang bar bya //
translated: Also drink a little alcohol, and avoid water and cold drinks.

original: rlan la mi 'dug mi 'gro lus la char pas gsher mi bya //
analyzed: rlan la mi 'dug mi 'gro lus la char pas gsher mi bya //
translated: Do not sit in damp places, go out in the rain, or let your body get wet.

original: stobs dang drag shul ngal zhing dub par gyur pa'i bag dang yang //
analyzed: stobs dang drag shul ngal zhing dub par gyur pa'i bag dang yang //
translated: Avoid strenuous activities, such as lifting heavy objects, and strenuous sexual activity.

original: nyin mtshan mi bde nyin par mi log nyal po brtun byed spang //
analyzed: nyin mtshan mi bde nyin par mi log nyal po brtun byed spang //
translated: Do not sleep during the day, and avoid sexual intercourse at night.

original: gnas kyang rlan med rlung mi ldang la bsil bar stan bting 'dug / ston zla gnyis ni mkhris pa skye ba'i dus yin nad ldang bas //
analyzed: gnas kyang rlan med rlung mi ldang la bsil bar stan bting 'dug / ston zla gnyis ni mkhris pa skye ba'i dus yin nad ldang bas //
translated: In the two autumn months, when bile disorders are prevalent, sleep on a bed spread with a cool, dry, and windless cloth.

original: bsil mngar bkru sman gtang zhing gtar kas khrag kyang ci ran dbyung //
analyzed: bsil mngar bkru sman gtang zhing gtar kas khrag kyang ci ran dbyung //
translated: Take cooling and sweet purgatives, and perform bloodletting as needed.

original: kha zhing mngar la bsil ba'i sman yang rtag tu bza' bar bya //
analyzed: kha zhing mngar la bsil ba'i sman yang rtag tu bza' bar bya //
translated: Always eat food that is light, sweet, and cooling.

original: dus 'di'i chu ni dug med gtsang dang bkrus shing 'thungs na phan //
analyzed: dus 'di'i chu ni dug med gtsang dang bkrus shing 'thungs na phan //
translated: Drink clean, uncontaminated water, which is beneficial when used for washing.

original: zas kyang 'bras nas sran ma sbrang rtsi kha ra sha la sogs //
analyzed: zas kyang 'bras nas sran ma sbrang rtsi kha ra sha la sogs //
translated: Eat foods such as rice, lentils, honey, sugar, and meat.

original: mngar zhing kha la yang ba mar sar 'o ma bza' zhing btung //
analyzed: mngar zhing kha la yang ba mar sar 'o ma bza' zhing btung //
translated: Eat and drink sweet, light, and cooling foods such as ghee, milk, and curd.

original: chang lci drag po'i ro yod mi btung ra ror mi bya ste /
analyzed: chang lci drag po'i ro yod mi btung ra ror mi bya ste /
translated: Do not drink heavy, strong, or hot alcohol, or become intoxicated.

original: tshil dang til mar mi bza' zil par mi 'gro 'dug mi bya //
analyzed: tshil dang til mar mi bza' zil par mi 'gro 'dug mi bya //
translated: Do not eat fat or sesame oil, do not sit in the shade.

original: tsha ba'i zas dang yul yang zla grogs yid du 'ong ba bsten //
analyzed: tsha ba'i zas dang yul yang zla grogs yid du 'ong ba bsten //
translated: Eat hot foods and live in a warm place, with a pleasant companion.

original: chu 'jam tsam gyis lus bkru gos kyang dri ma med pa bgo //
analyzed: chu 'jam tsam gyis lus bkru gos kyang dri ma med pa bgo //
translated: Wash your body with lukewarm water, and wear clean clothes.

original: rgyan dang dri zhim lus la gdags shing nyin mtshan mi bde ste //
analyzed: rgyan dang dri zhim lus la gdags shing nyin mtshan mi bde ste //
translated: Adorn yourself with ornaments and fragrant substances, and stay in a comfortable place day and night.🔽Sit in a warm, sheltered place, not exposed to cold winds, and in a cool place.

analyzed: gnas kyang dro min ser bus mi phog bsil bag can la 'dug / dgun stod dgun smad zla bzhi phyi grang nang tsha bad kan sogs //
translated: In the first and last months of winter, the four months outside are cold, inside warm, with phlegm and so on.

analyzed: gos dror bgo zhing rlan dang lhags pa bag bya nyi ma'ang 'di //
translated: Wear warm clothes, protect yourself from dampness and wind, and also from the sun.

original: zas kyang sha tshon rus khu mar tshil snum bag 'grangs par bza' //
analyzed: zas kyang sha tshon rus khu mar tshil snum bag 'grangs par bza' //
translated: Eat meat, soup, marrow, fat, and oil to your satisfaction.

original: mngar skyur lan tshva drod bag cher bza' gsar tog 'bru dag bza' //
analyzed: mngar skyur lan tshva drod bag cher bza' gsar tog 'bru dag bza' //
translated: Eat sweet, sour, and salty foods, which are warm and nourishing, and new grain.

original: ran par sna tshogs chang btung ngal ba'i las dag byas kyang sla //
analyzed: ran par sna tshogs chang btung ngal ba'i las dag byas kyang sla //
translated: Drink alcohol in moderation, and do light work.

original: rtsel bcag lus sbyang skabs skabs mgo lus til mar bsku zhing mnye //
analyzed: rtsel bcag lus sbyang skabs skabs mgo lus til mar bsku zhing mnye //
translated: Massage your body, and occasionally oil your head and body.

original: de rjes skyu ru ra la sogs pa sman bskol chus kyang bkru //
analyzed: de rjes skyu ru ra la sogs pa sman bskol chus kyang bkru //
translated: After that, one should also wash with a decoction of medicinal plants such as emblic myrobalan.

original: gnas kyang bsro khang dron por me dang stan stug ldan par 'dug / dbyar stod tsha dus dbyar smad rlung dus bkru sman mi gtang ste //
analyzed: gnas kyang bsro khang dron por me dang stan stug ldan par 'dug / dbyar stod tsha dus dbyar smad rlung dus bkru sman mi gtang ste //
translated: The place should be a warm sauna with fire and thick bedding. One should not give purgative medicine in the hot season of early summer or in the windy season of late summer.

original: dgun stod dgun smad grang dang rgas la skyug sman gtar ga spang //
analyzed: dgun stod dgun smad grang dang rgas la skyug sman gtar ga spang //
translated: In the cold seasons of early and late winter, one should avoid emetic medicine and bloodletting for the elderly.

original: dgun gnyis dbyar stod lums dugs mi bya @10b nad kyis gzir kyang sla //
analyzed: dgun gnyis dbyar stod lums dugs mi bya @10b nad kyis gzir kyang sla //
translated: In the two winters and early summer, one should not do fomentation and sudation, even if afflicted by illness.

original: de ltar yin yang lus dang nad du gar mthun brtsam par bya //
analyzed: de ltar yin yang lus dang nad du gar mthun brtsam par bya //
translated: However, one should engage in what is suitable for the body and the illness.

original: rlung mkhris bad kan gsum dang 'phrod pas 'tsho ba'i mdo brjod nas //
analyzed: rlung mkhris bad kan gsum dang 'phrod pas 'tsho ba'i mdo brjod nas //
translated: Having recited the Sutra on Nourishing Life, which is suitable for the three humors of wind, bile, and phlegm,

original: bag byed spyod lam can dag ring du 'tsho phyir yang bstan pa //
analyzed: bag byed spyod lam can dag ring du 'tsho phyir yang bstan pa //
translated: I will also teach for the sake of longevity those who are careful and of good conduct.

original: med smra cir yang chos dang rigs pa gzhan dag gsum la 'dzem //
analyzed: med smra cir yang chos dang rigs pa gzhan dag gsum la 'dzem //
translated: One should avoid the three: non-existent speech, anything that is Dharma, and other rationales.

original: sngar byas nang nub bsam zhing skyor dor phyin chag bag cher bya //
analyzed: sngar byas nang nub bsam zhing skyor dor phyin chag bag cher bya //
translated: Reflecting on past actions, one should be very cautious about what to adopt and abandon.

original: byed pa gang la rdul med rang nyam med cing 'dod chen spang //
analyzed: byed pa gang la rdul med rang nyam med cing 'dod chen spang //
translated: Do not be arrogant, but be humble, and give up greed.

original: nga rgyal lang tshos spyi brtol che min shes dman khum mi bya //
analyzed: nga rgyal lang tshos spyi brtol che min shes dman khum mi bya //
translated: Do not be conceited by youth and pride, but be humble to the learned.

original: sdig grogs spang zhing dge bshes bsten te gtong smos dge bcu spyad //
analyzed: sdig grogs spang zhing dge bshes bsten te gtong smos dge bcu spyad //
translated: Abandon evil friends, rely on spiritual teachers, and practice generosity, morality, and so forth.

original: gsong des tshul chags gzhan la gnod min mi la byams par bya //
analyzed: gsong des tshul chags gzhan la gnod min mi la byams par bya //
translated: Be honest, keep your promises, do not harm others, and be kind to people.

original: lha dang rgyal por nyer bsam lung mnyan yid dang mthun par sgrub //
analyzed: lha dang rgyal por nyer bsam lung mnyan yid dang mthun par sgrub //
translated: Think of the gods and the king, listen to the scriptures, and practice in accordance with your beliefs.

original: rgyal po'i sras dang rma ni chung yang mi brnyas bag cher bya //
analyzed: rgyal po'i sras dang rma ni chung yang mi brnyas bag cher bya //
translated: Do not despise the king’s sons or the wounded, but be careful.

original: spyod lam sgyu mas mi bslu bka' khrims yul chos bsrung //
analyzed: spyod lam sgyu mas mi bslu bka' khrims yul chos bsrung //
translated: Do not deceive with deceitful behavior, but protect the king’s laws and local customs.

original: gzhan gyi dpyas skyon mi brjod rtog 'dod gtum chos 'gran mi bya //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dpyas skyon mi brjod rtog 'dod gtum chos 'gran mi bya //
translated: Do not speak of others’ faults, and do not engage in quarrels out of desire for gain.

original: dge slong slob dpon pha ma'i gong du mi 'gro sri zhu skyed //
analyzed: dge slong slob dpon pha ma'i gong du mi 'gro sri zhu skyed //
translated: Do not walk in front of monks, teachers, or parents, but generate respect.

original: dge sbyong drang srong srog chags ya mtshan mnyan gtod sbrul mi rtse //
analyzed: dge sbyong drang srong srog chags ya mtshan mnyan gtod sbrul mi rtse //
translated: Do not play with ascetics, sages, or strange creatures, and do not play with snakes.

original: ma rtogs shing chen mchod rten drung dang lam mdo phug stod dang // sems can mang du bsad pa'i slo sa dur khrod nyal mi bya //
analyzed: ma rtogs shing chen mchod rten drung dang lam mdo phug stod dang // sems can mang du bsad pa'i slo sa dur khrod nyal mi bya //
translated: Do not sleep in a place where many beings have been killed, such as a charnel ground, a great uninhabited shrine, or a cave on a high road.

original: gnyan pa'i mtsho dang chu mig bzang por mi bkru mi bshal te //
analyzed: gnyan pa'i mtsho dang chu mig bzang por mi bkru mi bshal te //
translated: Do not wash or rinse your mouth in a sacred lake or a good spring.

original: rdo shing dgon pa'i shing chen mi bcad pha bong gzhom mi bya //
analyzed: rdo shing dgon pa'i shing chen mi bcad pha bong gzhom mi bya //
translated: Do not cut down a large tree in a rocky or wooded area, nor break up a boulder.

original: mchod rten rgyal mtshan aarga'i grib ma mandal mi 'gong zhing ;
analyzed: mchod rten rgyal mtshan aarga'i grib ma mandal mi 'gong zhing ;
translated: Do not step over a stupa, a victory banner, or the shadow of an arhat, nor over a mandala.

original: / mi ro gtor ma yas stags hom khung thal khung bcag mi bya //🔽nam mkha' ban bun nyi ma phyed dang dmar thag chad pa'i tshe //
analyzed: / mi ro gtor ma yas stags hom khung thal khung bcag mi bya // nam mkha' ban bun nyi ma phyed dang dmar thag chad pa'i tshe //
translated: Do not break up a human bone, a torma, a ritual substance, a hearth, or an ash mound.

original: mi bza' mi btung yi ge klog min nyal po las dang yang //
analyzed: mi bza' mi btung yi ge klog min nyal po las dang yang //
translated: Do not eat, drink, read, or have sex when the sky is hazy, at noon, or at dawn.

original: nyi ma la sogs 'od zer phra sngags mi ring ring mi blta //
analyzed: nyi ma la sogs 'od zer phra sngags mi ring ring mi blta //
translated: Do not look at the sun or other bright lights for a long time.

original: lha khang sgor mi nyal te ri sna grog snar gnas mi bca' //
analyzed: lha khang sgor mi nyal te ri sna grog snar gnas mi bca' //
translated: Do not sleep at the door of a temple, nor stay in a place with a steep mountain or an anthill.

original: ya mtshan shes drag mi bsten bud med ngag mi mnyan //
analyzed: ya mtshan shes drag mi bsten bud med ngag mi mnyan //
translated: Do not rely on a very strange person, nor listen to the words of a woman.

original: bud med rgan la mi rgyo rtsal rgyos smra 'gros dub mi bya //
analyzed: bud med rgan la mi rgyo rtsal rgyos smra 'gros dub mi bya //
translated: Do not spit on the ground in front of an elder or a noble person.

original: gang mo che zhing ring du dgod dang dud mo drag po spang //
analyzed: gang mo che zhing ring du dgod dang dud mo drag po spang //
translated: Do not laugh loudly or talk frivolously in their presence.

original: rtag tu mi 'dug ring du mi 'greng @11a * //🔽ci nus ran par bcag / sbrid pa lud pa khu chu mchi ma snabs 'phyen bshang gci dbyal //
analyzed: rtag tu mi 'dug ring du mi 'greng @11a * // ci nus ran par bcag / sbrid pa lud pa khu chu mchi ma snabs 'phyen bshang gci dbyal //
translated: Do not sit or stand too far away.🔽Sneezing, spitting, nasal mucus, tears, and phlegm should be expelled without obstruction or restraint.

original: mi dgag ma bsgrus bkres skom nad gnyid gnag min myur du bsal //
analyzed: mi dgag ma bsgrus bkres skom nad gnyid gnag min myur du bsal //
translated: Hunger, thirst, illness, and sleepiness should be relieved as soon as possible.

original: nyal po skigs pa lud pa la sogs tshe lus mjang mi gcu //
analyzed: nyal po skigs pa lud pa la sogs tshe lus mjang mi gcu //
translated: Do not belch or spit while eating.

original: glal na kha dgab sbrid pa smra tshe ha cang kha mi bgrad //
analyzed: glal na kha dgab sbrid pa smra tshe ha cang kha mi bgrad //
translated: When yawning, cover your mouth; when sneezing, do not open your mouth widely.

original: sen mo ring du mi bzhag bregs te phan tshun brud mi bya //
analyzed: sen mo ring du mi bzhag bregs te phan tshun brud mi bya //
translated: Do not let your nails grow too long, but do not pare them down to the quick.

original: mgo lus lag pas mi brdab mgo bo drag tu mi sprugs te //
analyzed: mgo lus lag pas mi brdab mgo bo drag tu mi sprugs te //
translated: Do not slap your body or head, or shake your head violently.

original: don med sa mi bri zhing lag pa mi brdab mchu mi bri //
analyzed: don med sa mi bri zhing lag pa mi brdab mchu mi bri //
translated: Do not draw meaningless lines on the ground, or snap your fingers, or whistle.

original: mi nus bzhin du ci mi gdags te mya ngan gnan mi bya ;
analyzed: mi nus bzhin du ci mi gdags te mya ngan gnan mi bya ;
translated: Do not make meaningless gestures, or sigh deeply.

original: / dpyid dang dbyar stod ston ni phyugs mar dus bzhin til mar gyis //
analyzed: / dpyid dang dbyar stod ston ni phyugs mar dus bzhin til mar gyis //
translated: In spring, early summer, and autumn, like a cowherd, with oil

original: rtag tu mgo dang rkang mthil bsku zhing bar bar lus kyang bsku //
analyzed: rtag tu mgo dang rkang mthil bsku zhing bar bar lus kyang bsku //
translated: One should always massage the head and soles of the feet, and from time to time the body as well.

original: ston dpyid ma yin dus gzhan res 'ga' sna dang rna bar til mar blugs //
analyzed: ston dpyid ma yin dus gzhan res 'ga' sna dang rna bar til mar blugs //
translated: In the non-autumn, non-spring seasons, occasionally one should put oil in the nose and ears.

original: skyer pa'i khanda stang zil dag gis bar bar mig kyang bsku //
analyzed: skyer pa'i khanda stang zil dag gis bar bar mig kyang bsku //
translated: From time to time one should massage the eyes with mustard oil and the juice of the khanda plant.

original: rtag tu lus kyi byi dor bya zhing sman sngags rin chen gdags //
analyzed: rtag tu lus kyi byi dor bya zhing sman sngags rin chen gdags //
translated: One should always groom the body and wear precious medicines and amulets.

original: ser bu drag po mi ro'i dri dang dud pas phog mi bya //
analyzed: ser bu drag po mi ro'i dri dang dud pas phog mi bya //
translated: One should not be struck by strong winds, the smell of corpses, or smoke.🔽One should not wash the head or body with a water clock, or after taking emetic or purgative medicine, or when a cold has not subsided.

original: chu tshas mgo lus mi bkru bkru sman skyug sman gtang ba dang // cham pa ma zhus btab ste mgo lus mi bkru snum mi bsku //
analyzed: chu tshas mgo lus mi bkru bkru sman skyug sman gtang ba dang // cham pa ma zhus btab ste mgo lus mi bkru snum mi bsku //
translated: One should not wash the head or apply oil.

original: skya rengs shar nas tsog pur 'dug ste de ring ci bya bsam //
analyzed: skya rengs shar nas tsog pur 'dug ste de ring ci bya bsam //
translated: At dawn, sitting cross-legged, one should contemplate what to do that day.

original: langs nas so shing bca' zhing kha yi skyon bsal lag gdong bkru //
analyzed: langs nas so shing bca' zhing kha yi skyon bsal lag gdong bkru //
translated: Having risen, one should chew tooth wood and remove impurities from the mouth, washing the hands and face.

original: de nas sman mchog aa ru ra ni rtag zos bdud rtsi yin //
analyzed: de nas sman mchog aa ru ra ni rtag zos bdud rtsi yin //
translated: Then, always eating the supreme medicine Haritaki, which is nectar,

original: lug gi mar min mar sar zhun mar rgas sra tshe ring ste //
analyzed: lug gi mar min mar sar zhun mar rgas sra tshe ring ste //
translated: Not the fat of sheep, but clarified butter, oil, and marrow.

original: 'di la sogs pa lus dang tshe la phan pa'i sman zos na //
analyzed: 'di la sogs pa lus dang tshe la phan pa'i sman zos na //
translated: Having eaten these and other medicines that are beneficial to the body and life,

original: byug pa rgyan dang gos kyis shin tu mdzes byas lha yang mchod //
analyzed: byug pa rgyan dang gos kyis shin tu mdzes byas lha yang mchod //
translated: One should be well adorned with ointments, ornaments, and clothes, and worship the gods.

original: de nas sri zhu'i gnas dang 'khor la snyan brjod 'dzum bstan nas //
analyzed: de nas sri zhu'i gnas dang 'khor la snyan brjod 'dzum bstan nas //
translated: Then, having announced to the retinue and the court with a smile,

original: rje dpon las dang bdag gzhan don la nan tan brtson 'grus skyed //
analyzed: rje dpon las dang bdag gzhan don la nan tan brtson 'grus skyed //
translated: The lord should generate diligence and exertion for the sake of his own and others' work.

original: dus bzhir dro bab ran par zas bza' ngoms par skom 'thung ste //
analyzed: dus bzhir dro bab ran par zas bza' ngoms par skom 'thung ste //
translated: At the four times, one should eat food that is warm and suitable, and drink water to one's satisfaction.

original: thug pa khu tshan la sogs snum lci drod kun sngar bza' zhing //
analyzed: thug pa khu tshan la sogs snum lci drod kun sngar bza' zhing //
translated: First, one should eat all the oily, heavy, and warm foods such as porridge,

original: 'bras la sogs pa bsil yang phyis bza' 'phrad med phye ma 'gam //🔽bab chol ha cang 'grangs par bza' min myos par chang mi btung //
analyzed: 'bras la sogs pa bsil yang phyis bza' 'phrad med phye ma 'gam // bab chol ha cang 'grangs par bza' min myos par chang mi btung //
translated: And later eat the cool rice and so on, without mixing them.🔽One should not eat haphazardly or to the point of fullness, and one should not drink alcohol to the point of intoxication.

original: 'bras kyis 'grangs rjes phye zan mi bza' @11b drod rjes skom mi btung //
analyzed: 'bras kyis 'grangs rjes phye zan mi bza' @11b drod rjes skom mi btung //
translated: After being full of rice, one should not eat flour, and after being warm, one should not drink water.

original: skyo ma ran par 'thungs na lus brta nang na rgan la bsod //
analyzed: skyo ma ran par 'thungs na lus brta nang na rgan la bsod //
translated: If one drinks gruel to one's satisfaction, the body becomes stiff and the stomach becomes old.

original: bro drug gang yang gcig la cher zos nad ldang ran par sbyar //
analyzed: bro drug gang yang gcig la cher zos nad ldang ran par sbyar //
translated: If one eats too much of any of the six tastes, the corresponding disease will arise.

original: 'grangs pa'i rjes la nyal po bang stobs rta rgyug la sogs spang //
analyzed: 'grangs pa'i rjes la nyal po bang stobs rta rgyug la sogs spang //
translated: After a full meal, avoid sex, strenuous activity, horse riding, and so forth.

original: shing tog ldam ldum mang na nad ldang ba mos phog pa gnod //
analyzed: shing tog ldam ldum mang na nad ldang ba mos phog pa gnod //
translated: If one eats a lot of raw fruit, it will cause disease.

original: dbyar zla 'bring po'i tshes la ldam ldum bza' drag nad du gyur //
analyzed: dbyar zla 'bring po'i tshes la ldam ldum bza' drag nad du gyur //
translated: Eating raw fruit in the middle summer month will cause a severe illness.

original: nad can lums kyis drangs te mgyogs na nad ldang skran du 'ong //
analyzed: nad can lums kyis drangs te mgyogs na nad ldang skran du 'ong //
translated: If a sick person is treated with moxibustion, if it is too quick, the illness will arise as a tumor.

original: mchin pa g-yer ma spangs te zos na cung zad snying la gnod //
analyzed: mchin pa g-yer ma spangs te zos na cung zad snying la gnod //
translated: If one eats the liver and spleen, it will slightly harm the heart.

original: zas mchog sbrang rtsi mar rnying cha mnyam zos na dug bzhin gnod //
analyzed: zas mchog sbrang rtsi mar rnying cha mnyam zos na dug bzhin gnod //
translated: Eating the best food, honey and old butter, in equal parts, will harm like poison.

original: mi mnyam che chung byas kyang zos rjes chang du 'thungs na gnod //
analyzed: mi mnyam che chung byas kyang zos rjes chang du 'thungs na gnod //
translated: If one eats an unequal amount, large or small, and then drinks beer after the meal, it will harm.

original: ma langs zho dang langs ma thag gi zho dron nad kun slong //
analyzed: ma langs zho dang langs ma thag gi zho dron nad kun slong //
translated: Unripened curd and curd just taken from the fire will cause all diseases.

original: chu bya dbyar spang ldum mchog ke'u ni dbyar zla 'bring po'i sman //
analyzed: chu bya dbyar spang ldum mchog ke'u ni dbyar zla 'bring po'i sman //
translated: Waterfowl, summer vegetables, and the best ke’u plant are the medicine for the middle summer month.

original: sman 'thungs sha pa'i sha gnod ga gon zho 'drer rims su 'gyur //
analyzed: sman 'thungs sha pa'i sha gnod ga gon zho 'drer rims su 'gyur //
translated: The flesh of a carnivorous animal is harmful when taken with medicine. Milk curd is harmful when taken with sesame oil.

original: btsong bsregs sbrang rtsir mi 'phrod lhan cig zos na 'chi bar 'gyur //
analyzed: btsong bsregs sbrang rtsir mi 'phrod lhan cig zos na 'chi bar 'gyur //
translated: Cooked meat is harmful when taken with honey. Taken together, they cause death.

original: ke'u 'am gnag sha lhan cig zos na skran du 'gyur //
analyzed: ke'u 'am gnag sha lhan cig zos na skran du 'gyur //
translated: If one eats together the flesh of a cow and a black antelope, it causes a tumor.

original: dgun stong rgya g-yer zos na snying ni drags na mig kyang mdongs //
analyzed: dgun stong rgya g-yer zos na snying ni drags na mig kyang mdongs //
translated: If one eats in winter a large quantity of radish, the heart is disturbed and the eyes are blinded.

original: mar tshil zos dang mi 'phrod lha ba bza' drags na so 'byung //
analyzed: mar tshil zos dang mi 'phrod lha ba bza' drags na so 'byung //
translated: Butter and fat are harmful when taken together. Eating a large quantity of radish causes toothache.

original: bra bo mang du zos na rlung dang lus g-ya' ste //
analyzed: bra bo mang du zos na rlung dang lus g-ya' ste //
translated: If one eats a large quantity of barley, it causes wind and itching of the body.

original: nub mo chu 'thung chang gnon la phug rnyid dang sha skam spang //
analyzed: nub mo chu 'thung chang gnon la phug rnyid dang sha skam spang //
translated: Drinking water in the evening, pressing wine, garlic, sleep, and dried meat are to be avoided.

original: nya dang kha tsha mar tshil mi 'phrod snod kyang gcig mi bya //
analyzed: nya dang kha tsha mar tshil mi 'phrod snod kyang gcig mi bya //
translated: Fish and salt are not to be taken together. They are not to be put in the same container.

original: nya dang 'o ma lhan cig mang zos nang na zer ma gnod //
analyzed: nya dang 'o ma lhan cig mang zos nang na zer ma gnod //
translated: If one eats a large quantity of fish and milk together, it causes internal worms.

original: shing tog chang la sogs te skyur dang shang tshe la phug rlon ;
analyzed: shing tog chang la sogs te skyur dang shang tshe la phug rlon ;
translated: Fruits, wine, etc., sour, mustard, and garlic are cold.

original: / nyungs rnying 'di rnams gang yang 'o mar 'phrod min mang zos gnod //
analyzed: / nyungs rnying 'di rnams gang yang 'o mar 'phrod min mang zos gnod //
translated: Old mustard seed is not suitable with milk. Eating a large quantity of any of these is harmful.

original: 'o tshan 'thungs rjes chu grog 'thungs dang rgya sran nag po gnod //
analyzed: 'o tshan 'thungs rjes chu grog 'thungs dang rgya sran nag po gnod //
translated: After drinking milk, drink water; after eating black beans, it is harmful.

original: zla ba spyang kis zin tshe zan zos so na shu ba 'byung //
analyzed: zla ba spyang kis zin tshe zan zos so na shu ba 'byung //
translated: If the moon is eclipsed, if you eat barley flour, you will get leprosy.

original: gnag sha rta sha lhan cig zos na lus la g-yan pa 'ong //
analyzed: gnag sha rta sha lhan cig zos na lus la g-yan pa 'ong //
translated: If you eat beef and horse meat together, you will get body scabies.

original: gnag sha phag sha lhan cig zos na lho yi srin bur 'gyur //
analyzed: gnag sha phag sha lhan cig zos na lho yi srin bur 'gyur //
translated: If you eat beef and pork together, you will become a southern louse.

original: nya dang khyim bya'i sha gnyis lhan cig zos na skran du 'gyur //
analyzed: nya dang khyim bya'i sha gnyis lhan cig zos na skran du 'gyur //
translated: If you eat fish and chicken together, you will get a tumor.

original: khyim bya'i sgo nga'i spri dang sgog skya zos na dbugs mi bde //
analyzed: khyim bya'i sgo nga'i spri dang sgog skya zos na dbugs mi bde //
translated: If you eat chicken eggs and garlic, you will get dyspnea.

original: khyim bya'i sha dang ri bong sha gnyis lhan cig zos na cung zad 'khru //
analyzed: khyim bya'i sha dang ri bong sha gnyis lhan cig zos na cung zad 'khru //
translated: If you eat chicken and rabbit meat together, you will have a little diarrhea.

original: sha mo yungs mar @12a * //
analyzed: sha mo yungs mar @12a * //
translated: If you eat mushrooms and mustard oil

original: nang du brdos pa zos na lus la gnod //🔽ma nu'i sa bon ka tsam sbrang rtsir 'phrad ma yin //
analyzed: nang du brdos pa zos na lus la gnod // ma nu'i sa bon ka tsam sbrang rtsir 'phrad ma yin //
translated: together, it is harmful to the body.🔽The seed of the mango does not meet with honey.

original: la phug bu ram mi 'phrod zho dang bya gag shar mi 'phrod //
analyzed: la phug bu ram mi 'phrod zho dang bya gag shar mi 'phrod //
translated: The garlic does not meet with molasses; the curd does not meet with the crow.

original: de ltar 'phrod zas goms dang rtag tu chags pa dang // lang tsho 'ju slas zos dang nyung na gnod pa med dang bsre //
analyzed: de ltar 'phrod zas goms dang rtag tu chags pa dang // lang tsho 'ju slas zos dang nyung na gnod pa med dang bsre //
translated: Thus, one should be accustomed to suitable food, always be attached to it, eat when young and when one’s digestion is good, and not eat when one is weak.

original: 'phrod pa'i zas zos phyi dro'i las byas nam sros bde bar nyal //
analyzed: 'phrod pa'i zas zos phyi dro'i las byas nam sros bde bar nyal //
translated: Having eaten suitable food, one should work in the afternoon, and sleep happily when night falls.

original: de ltar nan tan bag byas mi tshe tshad bzhin 'tsho nges pas //
analyzed: de ltar nan tan bag byas mi tshe tshad bzhin 'tsho nges pas //
translated: Thus, if one is careful and persistent, one will certainly live the full life span.

original: skyes nas lo bcu'i bar du sma mi dbab cing rang dgar gzhag / de nas nyi shu lon te lo bcur bslab dang brtsal bar bya //
analyzed: skyes nas lo bcu'i bar du sma mi dbab cing rang dgar gzhag / de nas nyi shu lon te lo bcur bslab dang brtsal bar bya //
translated: Until the age of ten, one should not shave or be independent, but should be left to one’s own devices. Then, having reached twenty, one should study and strive for ten years.

original: de nas lnga bcu lnga lon sum cu rtsa lnga khyud 'khor du //
analyzed: de nas lnga bcu lnga lon sum cu rtsa lnga khyud 'khor du //
translated: Then, having reached thirty-five, one should be engaged in the affairs of the kingdom for thirty-five years.

original: longs spyod grags pa'i yul srid gtam byas nas //
analyzed: longs spyod grags pa'i yul srid gtam byas nas //
translated: Having discussed the affairs of the kingdom, enjoyments, and fame,

original: lnga bcu lnga lon phyin chad chos lam yum gyi ched bsgrub phyir //
analyzed: lnga bcu lnga lon phyin chad chos lam yum gyi ched bsgrub phyir //
translated: after reaching fifty-five, in order to accomplish the path of Dharma,

original: dge la brtson bskyed thos rig goms byed lus sems ci bder gnas /
analyzed: dge la brtson bskyed thos rig goms byed lus sems ci bder gnas /
translated: one should generate effort in virtue, study and contemplate, and remain with body and mind at ease.
